Title: Post-rolandic cortical projections of the superior temporal sulcus in the rhesus monkey
Abstract:
The efferent connections of different cytoarchitectonic areas of the superior temporal sulcus (STS) in the rhesus monkey with parieto-temporo-occipital cortex were investigated using autoradiographic methods. Four rostral-to-caudal subdivisions of cortex (area TPO) in the upper bank of the STS have distinct projection patterns. Rostral sectors (areas TPO-1 and -2) project to the rostral superior temporal gyrus (areas Ts1, Ts2, and Ts3), insula of the Sylvian fissure, and parahippocampal gyrus (perirhinal and prorhinal cortexes, areas TF, TH, and TL); caudal sectors (TPO-3 and -4) project to the caudal superior temporal gyrus (areas paAlt and Tpt), supratemporal plane (area               paAc), circular sulcus of the Sylvian fissure (area reIt), as well as medial paralimbic (areas 23, 24, and retrosplenial cortex) and extrastriate (areas 18 and 19) cortexes. Area TPO-1 does not project to the parietal lobe; area TPO-2 projects to the inferior parietal lobule; area TPO-3 to the lower bank of the intraparietal sulcus (IPS) (area POa); and area TPO-4 to medial parietal cortex (area PGm). Vision-related cortex (area TEa) in the rostral lower bank of the STS sends fibers to the rostral inferotemporal region (areas TE1, -2, and -3) and parahippocampal gyrus (perirhinal       cortex, areas TF and TL). Visual zones in the caudal lower bank and depth of the sulcus (area OAa, or MT and FST) project to the caudal inferotemporal region (areas TE3 and TEO), lateral preoccipital region (area V4), and lower bank of the IPS (area POa). A zone in the rostral depth of the STS (area IPa) projects to the rostral inferotemporal region, parahippocampal gyrus, insula of the Sylvian fissure, parietal operculum, and lower rim of the IPS (area PG). STS projections to parieto-temporo-occipital cortex have "feedforward," "feedbackward," and "side-to-side" laminar
patterns of termination similar to those of other cortical sensory systems. The differential connectivity supports the            cytoarchitectonic parcellation of the STS and suggests functional heterogeneity.The efferent connections of differentcytoarchitectonic areas of the superior temporal sulcus (STS) in the rhesus monkey with parieto-temporo-occipital cortex were investigated using autoradiographic methods. @BrainMaps_Delineation.Citation: "Injections were located according to the architectonic/connectional parcellation of the STS described below (Seltzer and Pandya, `78; `89b) (Fig. 1)." (p. 626)
@BrainMaps_Delineation.Comments:
Area Opt was not defined by SP78.
Area TEO was not defined by SP78 or SP89b.

@BrainMaps_UnspecificAdoption.Citation: "Unlike the previous monkey, case 2 demonstrated additional labelling in the parietal lobe: on the lateral surface, over the inferior parietal lobule (areas PFG, PG, and Opt); and on the medial surface, over the cingulate gyrus (areas 23 and 24)." p. 628
@BrainMaps_UnspecificAdoption.Comments: No more information about the definitions of areas 23 and area 24 is given in this article.

@Injections.Citation: "Case 1, the rostralmost of this series, had an injection that affected area TPO-1 as well as portions of the surrounding temporal pole (area Pro) and superior temporal gyrus (Ts1 and Ts2)."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "As shown in Firure 2A, this case displayed terminal label at a numerous site in the temporal lobe. These included the temporal pole (area Pro), rostral superior temporal gyrus (ventral areas Ts1 andTs2), and Sylvian fissure. In the last -named structure, label occured over both the circular sulcus (area Pro and paI; Pandya and Sanides, `73) and the ventral portion of the insula. ON the ventral surface of the temporal lobe in the parahippocampal gyrus, additional foci of labelling were noted in prorhinal amd perirhinal cortexes, area TH, and rostral and caudal sectors of area TL."

@Injections.Citation: "Though more caudal, the injections in cases 10 and 11also involved the rostral lower bank of the STS (area TEa). The injection for monkey 10 was comparatively large and spread to the lower rim of the sulcus (areaTEm) and adjacent inferotemporal cortex (TE2)."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "Case 10 displayed prominent foci of labelling over all architectonic divisions of the inferotemporal region (areas TE1, TE2, TE3, and TEO) (Fig. 5B). There was also labelling at two sites in the parahippocampal gyrus: ..."

@Injections.Citation: "Though more caudal, the injections in cases 10 and 11also involved the rostral lower bank of the STS (area TEa). The injection for monkey 10 was comparatively large and spread to the lower rim of the sulcus (areaTEm) and adjacent inferotemporal cortex (TE2)."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "Case 11(not illustrated)  had a similar pattern of labelling, i,e., the inferotempotal cortex and parahippocampal gyrus (area TL)."

@Injections.Citation: "Cases 12 and 13 had injections in the caudal portion of area TEa. The injection in case 12 ws small and confined to the sulcus, whereas isotope in case13 spread ventrally to areas TEm and TE3."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "Both cases demonstrated labelling of inferotemporal areas TE1, TE2, TE3, and TEO (Fig. 6A illustrates case 13), and monkey 13 had additional labelling over extrastriate cortex (area 19, V4) in the vicinity of the inferior occipital sulcus."

@Injections.Citation: "Cases 12 and 13 had injections in the caudal portion of area TEa. The injection in case 12 ws small and confined to the sulcus, whereas isotope in case13 spread ventrally to areas TEm and TE3."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "Both cases demonstrated labelling of inferotemporal areas TE1, TE2, TE3, and TEO (Fig. 6A illustrates case 13), and monkey 13 had additional labelling over extrastriate cortex (area 19, V4) in the vicinity of the inferior occipital sulcus."

@Injections.Citation: "Two cases had injections of area OAa. Case 14, which involved the junction of rostral area OAa and caudal area TEa, had terminal label ... ."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "...had terminal label in the inferotemporal region (primally areas TE3 and TEO) and inferior occipital sulcus (areas 19, V4) (Fig. 6B)."

@Injections.Citation: "Two cases had injections of area OAa....Case 15, whose injection was more caudal and involved both the depth and lower bank (areas MT and MST) of the sulcus... ."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "...demonstrated label over caudal inferotemporal cortex (areaTEO) and the midpreoccipital gyrus (area 19, V4). There was also a cluster of terminal label in the lower bank of the IPS (area POa) (Fig. 6C)."

@Injections.Citation: "Case 16 had an injection centered in the rostral depth of the STS. This principally affected area IPa, with minor spread of isotope to the adjacent lower bank (areaTEa) (Fig. 7)."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "Althought the superior temporal gyrus was free of terminal label, several clusters were found in the Sylvian fissure. These occured over both agranular and dysgranular cortexes of the insula, the second sensory area (SII) in the parietal operculum, and area ProM in the frontal operculum. Ventral to the STS, labelled terminals were observed in the temporal pole (areaPro), inferotemporal region (areas TE1, TE2, and TE3), and parahippocampal gyrus (perirhinal cortex (area35); rostral portions of areas TF and TH). One final site of labelling was the parietal lobe."

@Injections.Citation: "Case 2 had an upper bank injection at a slightly more caudal level. The injection was large and affected virtually all of area TPO-2 and the caudal portion of area TPO-1. It also spread medially to area PGa, laterally to areas TAa and Ts3, and dorsally to cortex of the Sylvian fissure (areas paI and paAr) (Fig. 2B)."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "Resulting terminal label was found in the temporal pole (area Pro), superior temporal gyrus (Ts1, Ts2, Ts3, and paAlt), and Sylvian fissure."

@Injections.Citation: "Cases 3 and 4 had  injections at the level of the junction between areas TPO-2 and -3."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "...and terminal label was found over cortex of both the superior temporal gyrus (areas Ts1, Ts2, and Ts3) and Sylvian fissure."

@Injections.Citation: "Cases 3 and 4 had injections at the junction between areas TPO2 and -3."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "In this case, terminal label occurred over the superior temporal gyrus (areas Ts2, Ts3, paALt, and Tpt), Sylvian fissure (areas paI and proA in the circular sulcus; areas KA and paAc in the supratemporal plane), and cingulate gyrus (area 23), but not over the ventral temporal and lateral parietal lobes."

@Injections.Citation: "The injection in case 5 involved virtually all of area TPO-3 as well as the adjacent upper rim (area TAa) of the STS and superior temporal gyrus (area Ts3).It also encroached upon the rostral portion of area KA within the Sylvian fissure."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "Case 5 showed several distinct foci of terminal label in post-Rolandic cortex (Fig. 3B). In the superior temporal gyrus these were situated over areas Ts2, Ts3, paAlt, and Tpt. In the Sylvian fissure, labelled terminals occured over granular cortex of the insula; areas proA and reIt, in the circular sulcus; and areas paAR, KA and paAc, in the supratemporal plane."

@Injections.Citation: "The injection in case 6, by contrast, was considerably smaller and confined to the upper bank of the STS (area TPO3)."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "The other monkey, case 6, also showed terminal labelling in the superior temporal gyrus (areas Ts1, Ts2, Ts3, and Tpt), but not over cortex in the Sylvian fissure (Fig. 3C)."

@Injections.Citation: "Case 7 had an injection in the rostral, and case 8 in the caudal, portion of area TPO-4."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "Monkey 7, whose injection also involved the caudal sector of area TPO-3, exhibited a moderate amount of labelling in the caudal superior temporal gyrus (areas Ts3, paAlt, and Tpt) and lateral fissure (circular sulcus, area reIt; supratemporal plane, area paAc) (Fig. 4A), but none in the insula amd ventral temporal lobe."

@Injections.Citation: "Case 7 had an injection in the rostral, and case 8 in the caudal, portion of area TPO-4. ...In case 8, isotope spread beyond the STS to the ventral inferior parietal lobule (caudal area PG and area Opt)."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "The overall pattern of labelling resembled that of case 7, viz. . caudal superior temporal gyrus (area Tpt), supratemporal plane (area paAc), medial surface of hemisphere (areas  PGm, 18, 19, and the junction of areas 23 and24) (Fig. 4B). ..."

@Injections.Citation: "The most rostral of this series (case 9) involved the ventral portion of sulcal proisocortex (area Pro) as well as rostral sectors of areas TEa and TEm.

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "As seen in Fig. 5A, this injection produced terminal label in the temporal pole (area Pro), inferotemporal cortex (areas TE1 and TE2), and ventral temporal lobe (perirhinal cortex (area 35b) and rostral area TL)."

publication.title: Post-rolandic cortical projections of the superior temporal sulcus in the rhesus monkey
publication.abstract:
The efferent connections of different cytoarchitectonic areas of the superior temporal sulcus (STS) in the rhesus monkey with parieto-temporo-occipital cortex were investigated using autoradiographic methods. Four rostral-to-caudal subdivisions of cortex (area TPO) in the upper bank of the STS have distinct projection patterns. Rostral sectors (areas TPO-1 and -2) project to the rostral superior temporal gyrus (areas Ts1, Ts2, and Ts3), insula of the Sylvian fissure, and parahippocampal gyrus (perirhinal and prorhinal cortexes, areas TF, TH, and TL); caudal sectors (TPO-3 and -4) project to the caudal superior temporal gyrus (areas paAlt and Tpt), supratemporal plane (area               paAc), circular sulcus of the Sylvian fissure (area reIt), as well as medial paralimbic (areas 23, 24, and retrosplenial cortex) and extrastriate (areas 18 and 19) cortexes. Area TPO-1 does not project to the parietal lobe; area TPO-2 projects to the inferior parietal lobule; area TPO-3 to the lower bank of the intraparietal sulcus (IPS) (area POa); and area TPO-4 to medial parietal cortex (area PGm). Vision-related cortex (area TEa) in the rostral lower bank of the STS sends fibers to the rostral inferotemporal region (areas TE1, -2, and -3) and parahippocampal gyrus (perirhinal       cortex, areas TF and TL). Visual zones in the caudal lower bank and depth of the sulcus (area OAa, or MT and FST) project to the caudal inferotemporal region (areas TE3 and TEO), lateral preoccipital region (area V4), and lower bank of the IPS (area POa). A zone in the rostral depth of the STS (area IPa) projects to the rostral inferotemporal region, parahippocampal gyrus, insula of the Sylvian fissure, parietal operculum, and lower rim of the IPS (area PG). patterns of termination similar to those of other cortical sensory systems.
